summary: This is an email from March 12, 2020, discussing a prosecution memo update regarding Ghislaine Maxwell. The sender provides editorial feedback on legal strategy, specifically debating the use of child endangerment as a charge and expressing reservations about the perjury argument. The email is addressed to an unnamed recipient and mentions 'Geoff' as a decision-maker.

persons.name: Geoff
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who will want the perjury argument included in the prosecution memo, indicating a supervisory or influential role in the legal strategy.

events.title: Prosecution Memo Update
events.description: Reference to an updated prosecution memo document concerning Ghislaine Maxwell, indicating ongoing case preparation.

keyFacts: The document is internal legal correspondence discussing strategy for the Ghislaine Maxwell prosecution.
The sender debates the legal viability of using 'child endangerment' as an underlying charge for sexual activity, citing Fourth Circuit law and potential jury interpretation.
The sender expresses reservations about the strength of the perjury argument against Maxwell but notes 'Geoff' will want it included.
The email references witnesses who will contradict Maxwell's statements, though specific names are not provided in the excerpt.
